markdown: <::A stack of four hexagonally cropped images. The top image shows a server rack with a gold/olive green triangular shape overlaying the right side. The second image from the top shows a close-up of a smiling man's face with light hair and blue eyes. The third image shows a close-up of a person's neck and shoulder wearing a purple t-shirt. The bottom image shows a close-up of a man's forehead and eyes with brown hair.: figure::>

<::A collage of hexagonal images showing close-ups of people, likely technicians or students, working on electrical wiring and components. To the right, the ROVC logo is displayed with the text "Technisch de beste opleider".: figure::>

<::A close-up photograph of a refrigeration unit, possibly an evaporator coil, heavily covered in a thick layer of white ice or frost. The unit appears to be inside a metal casing. On the right side, a blue fan with a protective grill is visible. Several copper tubes are seen, some also covered in ice. A small brass-colored solenoid valve is attached to one of the tubes, with a white label hanging from it that reads "SOLENOID HARNESS". The background on the left shows a textured surface, possibly the interior wall of a cold room. The overall impression is that of a system experiencing significant frosting, which can impede its efficiency.: photo::> Figuur 1

<::Aanvalsplan: flowchart::>Aanvalsplan: Storing -> Melding. Melding compleet? (Diamond). If no, then informatie verzamelen (Rectangle), which loops back to Melding. If yes, then technisch? (Diamond). If no, then installatie vertrouwd? (Diamond). If no, then informatie verzamelen (Rectangle), which loops back to Melding. If yes (from installatie vertrouwd), or if yes (from technisch), proceeds to Diagnose section. Diagnose section starts with 1 van de 3 P's? (Diamond). If ja, then proces instelling? (Diamond). If nee, then buiten installatie (Rectangle), which loops back to Storing. If ja (from proces instelling), then Oplossen (Rectangle). If nee (from 1 van de 3 P's), then 1 keten? (Diamond). If nee, then ketens uitsluiten (Rectangle), which loops back to 1 keten. If ja, then 1 onderdeel? (Diamond). If nee, then onderdelen uitsluiten (Rectangle), which loops back to 1 onderdeel. If ja, then Oplossen (Rectangle). The chart also has a vertical label "Informeren" on the right side of the blue section and "Diagnose" on the left side of the orange section. The logo at the bottom right is ROVC Technisch de beste opleider. Figuur 2 SMIDO-aanvalsplan gestructureerd storingzoeken

<::Diagram of a balance scale with a gauge at the top. The gauge is labeled with "Ondergrens" (Lower limit) in red, "Bandbreedte" (Bandwidth) in yellow, and "Bovengrens" (Upper limit) in black. The needle of the gauge points towards the center of the "Bandbreedte" section. Below the gauge, a balance beam is shown with two hanging platforms. On the left platform, the following items are listed: - EXPANSIEORGAAN - VERDAMPER - COMPRESSOR - CONDENSOR Below these items, it says "Etcetera". On the right platform, the following items are listed: - Koudemiddel hoeveelheid - Koellast product - Motorvermogen en verd/cond. temp - Hoeveelheid lucht/water - Omgevingstemperatuur Below these items, it says "Etcetera". In the center, between the two platforms, a set of horizontal arrows points in both directions, labeled "Onderlinge relatie" (Interrelationship), indicating connections between the items on the left and right sides. : diagram::> Figuur 3 In balans

koeltechniek<::A diagram illustrating a refrigeration cycle with labeled points showing the state of the refrigerant. The cycle consists of a compressor, a condenser, an expansion valve, and an evaporator.The flow of the refrigerant (R134a) is as follows:1. Refrigerant exits the expansion valve at -5°C, 1.4 bar (blue pipe).2. It flows through the evaporator (bottom coil with fans), absorbing heat. At the evaporator outlet, the refrigerant is -5°C, 1.4 bar (blue pipe).3. After the evaporator, the refrigerant (R134a) is at 5°C. It then enters a component (possibly an accumulator) and exits at 0°C, 1.4 bar (light blue pipe), flowing into the compressor.4. The compressor increases the pressure and temperature of the refrigerant. Refrigerant exits the compressor at 55°C, 9 bar (red pipe).5. It flows through the condenser (top coil with fans), releasing heat. At the condenser outlet, the refrigerant is 40°C, 9 bar (red pipe).6. The refrigerant then flows to the expansion valve, entering it at 35°C, 9 bar (yellow pipe).The cycle then repeats from point 1.: diagram::>

<::A modern, blue and white train is parked at a station platform. The station features a large, arched glass and steel roof, allowing natural light to illuminate the platform. In the background, through the glass, a large building with orange-brown facades is visible. On the right side of the platform, a blue sign with "10" and "Richting Schiphol" is displayed. The platform has white markings near the edge. The train has the NS logo (two connected letters 'N') on its side. There are reflections of the roof structure on the train's windows and the platform floor. Figuur 1 Airco in trein: image::>

<::flowchart: A flowchart illustrating the structure of a troubleshooting table. It consists of three blue rounded rectangles connected by right-pointing arrows. The first rectangle on the left contains the text: "Verschijnselen (locatie in de installatie)" (Symptoms (location in the installation)). An arrow points to the second rectangle, which contains the text: "Mogelijke oorzaken 1. 2. 3." (Possible causes 1. 2. 3.). Another arrow points to the third rectangle on the right, which contains the text: "Oplossingen (wat ga je controleren)" (Solutions (what are you going to check)). Figuur 5 Opbouw storingstabel::>

<::Image of a hand holding a smartphone displaying the 'FittersApp'. In the top left corner of the overall image, a red square logo with a white target symbol and a snowflake, and the word 'Danfoss' is visible. The smartphone screen shows the app's interface: a status bar with Wi-Fi, battery, and time '08:09'; a header with 'FittersApp' and several icons (information, globe, mail, plus sign); and the instruction 'Tap area of interest'. Below this, a detailed schematic diagram of a heating/cooling or refrigeration system is displayed. The diagram features two main components with coiled pipes (one blue, one red), connected by various lines (yellow, blue, red) to smaller components such as valves, sensors, a pump, and a blue pressure vessel.: figure::> Figuur 7 Danfoss App Trouble Shooter

<::A white, rectangular mobile cool-freezer cell with a door on the right side. The door and the left side of the unit both feature a blue circular logo with the text "Coolworld" in the center, and "VERHUUR", "RENTAL", "VERMIETUNG", and "LOCATION" around the perimeter. There is a ventilation grille on the left side of the unit. The unit has a dark grey base and is shown against a white background with a reflection beneath it. : photo::> Figuur 1 Coolworld mobiele koel- vriescel

<::A 2D graph, which is a pressure-enthalpy (P-h) diagram. The y-axis is labeled 'p' (pressure) and the x-axis is labeled 'h' (enthalpy). A bell-shaped curve, representing a saturation dome, is plotted on the graph. The curve originates from the bottom-left corner, extends upwards and to the right, forms a peak, and then descends towards the bottom-right, ending above the x-axis. This curve typically delineates the two-phase region (liquid-vapor mixture) from the single-phase regions (subcooled liquid and superheated vapor). Figuur 2 Basisindeling diagram: diagram::>
